thread.title: DA case: SC verdict to decide fate of Sasikala
thread.title_full: DA case: SC verdict to decide fate of Sasikala

author: Internet Desk
title: DA case: SC verdict to decide fate of Sasikala
text:
February 14, 2017 04:11   14, 2017 04:39 IST more-in Jayalalithaa wealth case Ruling will decide V.K.. Sasikala’s political future, personal liberty 
Not only AIADMK interim general secretary V.K. Sasikala’s political future, but her personal liberty, along with the legacy of former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Jayalalithaa, will depend on the verdict the Supreme Court will pronounce in a disproportionate assets case on Tuesday. 
At 10.30 a.m., a Bench of Justices Pinaki Chandra Ghose and Amitava Roy will deliver separate judgments on appeals filed by the Karnataka government and others against the acquittal of Jayalalithaa, Sasikala, J. Ilavarasi and V.N. Sudhakaran in the case, which has cast a shadow over Ms. Sasikala’s campaign for the chief minister’s chair. 
Read more | Supreme Court verdict in Jaya assets case today Possible outcomes 
The Supreme Court decision in the Disproportionate Assets Case will decide the fate of V.K. Sasikala and in many ways the future of Tamil Nadu politics as well. 
Click here to know the various scenarios that can play out in Tuesday's verdict. Battle for chief ministership 
As the battle for chief ministership between O. Panneerselvam and V.K. Sasikala gets drawn out, all eyes are on Tamil Nadu’s Acting Governor Ch Vidyasagar Rao. 
One of the options for Mr. Rao to end the battle is to convene a floor test and ask the contenders to prove the majority. 
The Tamil Nadu Assembly presently has 243 members, after the demise of Jayalalithaa. The Speaker normally does not participate in motions or votes. 
Know exactly how a floor test will proceed Conduct floor test: A-G 
Attorney-General Mukul Rohatgi on Monday advised Tamil Nadu Governor Ch. Vidyasagar Rao to hold a composite floor test in the Assembly. This, Mr. Rohatgi pointed out, would prove who had majority in the power tussle between AIADMK interim general secretary V.K. Sasikala and Chief Minister O. Panneerselvam.
